newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila says to keep o/night rate at 32 pct.
newsitem.headline: Manila says to keep o/night rate at 32 pct.

text.p: The Philippine Central Bank said on Friday it would maintain its overnight borrowing rate at 32 percent until the foreign exchange market calmed down.
"We are maintaining our overnight borrowing rates and other term rates and we will have to assess it as it develops," Central Bank managing director Amado Tetangco told Reuters.
Asked how long the rate would be maintained at the present level, Tetangco said: "Until the (foreign exchange) market stabilises."
The Philippines on Friday said it was allowing the peso to move in a wider range, which effectively meant a devaluation of the peso.
"We'll continue the prudent stance on monetary policy particularly during the period when the exchange rate is going to move within a wider band," Tetangco said.
"The impression that we will relax our monetary policy is incorrect," he added.
The Central Bank was forced to raise its overnight borrowing rate to 32 percent on Thursday in an attempt to curb speculative attacks on the peso.
